name: CatalyXtraction
body:
# CatalyXtraction
### Idea
* I wanted a way to extract the workouts from a workout routine on Catalyst Weightlifting website
* I wanted to take these workouts and be able to view only a particular day's workout without having to scroll

### Steps To Use
* Download the HTML doc for almost any workout routing from [Catalyst](https://www.catalystathletics.com/olympic-weightlifting-workouts/training-programs/) to a location you'll remember
* Place the path to your HTML doc in the python [script](https://github.com/rhudgeons/BeautifulSoup/blob/master/Catalyst/oly_program.py) like below:
```ruby
document = BeautifulSoup(open('path/to/your/workout/html'))
```
* Run: ```python oly_program.py``` 

* Open ```extracted_workouts.html``` in Chrome

### To Dos
* I will be adding styling to this so it's easier to look at
* Maybe write info to a csv file to view in Microsoft Excel too
* Use a GUI so you do not have to 1) use the command line to use and 2) enter the path to the downloaded HTML file on a prompt
* Give it the URL instead of having to download the HTML file

### Notes
This was a very minimalist project, so don't critique too much. I was just thinking of ways to use [BeautifulSoup](https://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/bs4/doc/) while learning a little python syntax. I use it myself and find it easier to use rather than scrolling through an entire workout routine.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
